headline: Monster Beverage posts surprise fall in quarterly net sales on choppy demand
summary: Colder weather in January and high inflation in February led to softer consumer spending, impacting sales during the quarter.  The company also attributed the decline in net sales to changes in ordering patterns of bottlers and distributors in the U.S. and Europe and foreign currency headwinds.  Monster Beverage hedges against the rise in aluminum prices, but said it would recognize tariffs imposed on imports of the material due to higher U.S. Midwest duty-paid aluminum premium, which climbed more than 70% in the three months through March.

headline: Monster Beverage (MNST) Tops Q1 Earnings Estimates
summary: Monster Beverage (MNST) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 2.17% and 6.40%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Monster (NASDAQ:MNST) Misses Q1 Revenue Estimates
summary: Energy drink company Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales falling 2.3% year on year to $1.85 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.47 per share was 2.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
